Perceptor:

The blind Predacon moved away of the throne Room, it was time f=
or his regular tasks and politics always bothered him, he was a scientist o=
ver all and several important matters Requires his attenion; he went to his=
 lab and  attached himself, thanks to a USB devise to the computer and star=
ted to check the segurity in the base... Somethign was terribly wrong a scr=
amblign wave had been detected and that meant one thing: Troubles   

He tu=
rn off the alarm and sealed the base, that sunken down in the lava pool whi=
le the segurity Drones were released.  Perceptor's lab (with Nightlight ins=
ide), the dungeons, CR's and Intelligence rooms had been secured, insolated=
 and sealed.

"This is Perceptor, We may have a posible intruder..." The Sg=
urity Drones are released to start a search party"

Hydras when he heard hi=
s security chief warning said "Every one take a search PArty and seek every=
 inch of this base"



From: Sandy 
Sent: Saturday, February 13, 2010 10:31=
 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Recovering Rodimus


  
ooc: Y=
ou got it. Cyclonus better be ready, Tucson isn't one to give up too quickl=
y. 

BIC:

The drive to succeed, it was now surging rapidly through Tucson'=
s pistons and fuel injectors. He wasn't about to let a little pot hole get =
in the way of him reaching his leader who he now believed was POW and held =
under demonic control. Reaching speeds of well over one twenty MPH he kicks=
 up dust beneath his tires and handles the roughness of the terrain as if i=
t were as smooth as newly laid down asphault. His sonar systems now pick up=
 the density and size of the dark tower which drives him forward, not to me=
ntion the fact that he could pick up heat signatures which resembled his ow=
n. He knew. Rodimus was there, and no doubt he'd be there with some familli=
ar enemies. The thought of Decepticons being involved in this enrages him e=
ven more.

He thinks things through while driving toward the tower, where h=
e could sense Rodimus's heat signatures.

" How could I have let this happe=
n? If I hadn't let my guard down the first time, and gotten myself shot, yo=
u wouldn't be in this mess Rodimus. I promise you this though, this time, I=
 will bring you back, and I will not abandon you. No matter how hateful you=
 are of me, no matter how badly you want to destroy me. My spark is dedicat=
ed to those I care deeply for. That part of me will never die. I will also =
make those who are responsible for what they have done to you, pay for what=
 they did. They had no right taking your spark and your soul. I swear by th=
e name of Primus that I will risk my own spark to see yours safely out of h=
arm's way."

He was now nearing the tower. Another familliar signature ping=
s loudly in his sonar system. He could tell by the frequency that it was fr=
om a Decepticon. He could also identify the carrier.

"Cyclonus... Ohh yeah=
, this definitely has your name writen all over it. Right, well, enjoy the =
party while it lasts because I'm about to crash it... Literally."

He sense=
s he's only a few feet from the tower, and transforms. Yet, he keeps hidden=
. He knew that an all out attack wasn't the best way to go. If he was going=
 to succeed in this mission, he'd have to do it without being seen and righ=
t underneath Cyclonus's nose. He was good at staying out of the sight of th=
e enemy. Not only had he trained with Kup, but also trained with Prowl. Sil=
ence was his middle name. He sends a low powered sonar wave to see if it pi=
cks up anything. In the general area he was clear of incombants. He knew th=
at if he touched the tower there could be an alarm system. He scans for tha=
t.

"Hmm... Just in case, I should activate a scrambling wave. That should =
quiet any security system that could be active here.. I hope."

He waits a =
good five minuts or so until he's sure that the system is disabled. Once he=
 runs a scan of his sonar systems, he concludes that it did indeed have a m=
ild effect on the system, which made it safe for him to approach the tower.=
 He again hides behind a mass of debris, and finds that breeze catches his =
face, from the opposite side of the tower. There was a door that was partia=
lly opened. He feels for it with his fingers, and quietly slides it open ju=
st enough to sqeeze in, which was a little bit of a squeeze for him. This w=
as it, he was inside. Again, not wanting to make it obvious, he quietly sli=
des the door just a bit ajar, to make sure he isn't discovered. Then, quiet=
ly he hides again, and stops to try to pick up Rodimus's heat signature onc=
e more. It was difficult, because his temperature continued to drop with ev=
ery ounce of energy that was being stolen from him. 

" All right, low heat=
 signature, this is going to make it a little difficult to track. Time to b=
oost up my receptors a bit... And it wouldn't hurt to scramble my signals e=
ither..." 

Tucson had never known fear and apprehension. With every slow s=
tep, he becomes more and more familliar with both emotions. He couldn't let=
 them stop him. He was doing this to save Rodimus, a gesture from the spark=
 who's power is relentless. His affections for his leader keeps him focused=
 on the task at hand. And it isn't long until his persistance pays off. The=
 ping was loud and clear, and yes, it was Rodimus. The signature read Decep=
ticon though. But knowing what Kenzo had told him, he keeps reserved. Now, =
he wanted to be seen and heard. With his cross bow subspaced he stands idol=
, but ready for anything. And quietly with a soft tone of voice..

"Rodimus=
."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote=
:
>
> Just to clarify. The physical structure that holds the energy of the =
matrix is still inside of Rodimus, but the energy itself was siphoned out b=
y Cyclonus during one of their climatic encounters. It was part of what has=
 given Cyclonus his new found power.
> 
> Sandy feel free to go ahead. I th=
ink this will all make for good RP. I look forward to it. 
> 
> Preston
> 
=
> 
> 
> 
> >

imus

> >OOC: Okay. Still works though, because Tucson =
doesn't know that it's left his body just yet. Last he knew he still had it=
.. Good thing he didn't remember anything after his first major injury. It =
works out. He'll find out when he finds him I guess.
> >
> >>--- In nbwrpg@=
yahoogroups. com, <airly2002@ ..> wrote:
> >>>
> >>> OOC: the matrix isnt i=
nside Rodimus is insinde of one minion I dont remember who
> >>> 
> >>> 
> =
>>> From: Sandy 
> >>> Sent: Friday, February 12, 2010 10:33 PM
> >>> To: n=
bwrpg@yahoogroups. com 
> >>> Subject: Recovering Rodimus
> >>> 
> >>> 
> >=
>> 
> >>> From what Kenzo had told him, Tucson could now put two and two to=
gether and now realized that his restoration abilities along with his skill=
s as a warrior, would be needed more than ever. To him Restoration was more=
 than just restoring artifacts, making them appear and work like new, it wa=
s also about restoring old programming and recovery of important data. He d=
id not know the extent of the corruption upon which was placed on Rodimus b=
ut he knew he couldn't just throw in the towel on his leader. Autobots stuc=
k together, and through thick and thin, he'd keep his pledge to never aband=
on his fellow Autobots. He also realized that if he was going to get anywhe=
re, he'd have to do it himself. 
> >>> 
> >>> "On second thought, I think I=
'll go this one alone. Don't wait up for me, I don't think I'll be back too=
 soon."
> >>> 
> >>> He bids Kenzo good bye and walks out of the room. 
> >=
>> 
> >>> "Oh before I forget, have the CR chamber prepared for Rodimus. He=
'll need it more than me." 
> >>> 
> >>> He was dead set on recovering his =
leader. And this time, nothing and no one would get in his way of achieving=
 his mission. He sends one final message to Lord Perseus.
> >>> 
> >>> "Lor=
d Perseus, it's come to my attention that my leader, Rodimus Prime, has bee=
n abducted and altered severely. This puts the Matrix of Leadership at a gr=
ave Risk, but most of all, his spark, which I believe is too precious to wa=
ste for evil purposes. I can not abandon my leader, not even in his corrupt=
ive state. I hereby announce that I am on route to locating my leader, and =
I DO intend to BRING HIM BACK. Hopefully, the damage can be reversed. If no=
t, there is question of the well being of the Matrix. I must recover it, pe=
rhaps not for my own personal gain, but for the benefit of Autobot kind. It=
's too precious to lose to the hands of those who thirst for power and gree=
d. I swear by Primus's name, I will return, but my return may not be a fast=
 one. May Primus guide you as he guides me. This is Tucson, signing off. I =
will report to you again, once I know more of the condition of my leader."
=
> >>> 
> >>> He signs off, gets off the ship, and transforms into SUV mode,=
 hoping to find Rodimus via his sonar systems.
> >>> 
> >>> Tag: Kraftlos a=
nd Cyclonus.
> >>>
> >
> >
> >
>
